original: Hallberg, Klas Wilhelm, fd. rektor, Ronneby, f. 15/6/80 i Ryssby, Kalmar 1. G. 08 m. Ossie Aström. Barn: Olof f. 17. — Mog:ex. i Kalmar 03, fiil. kand. i Upps. 07, stud. v. Lindesbergs tekn. aftonsk. 08-10, rektor v. Lindesbergs |statsunderstödda samsk. ,samma tid, förest, f. Ronneby tekn. aftonsk. 10-12, rektor där 12-30, rektor v. Ronneby samsk. 10-12, rektor v. Ronneby komm. melilamsk. 12-28, adj. i kristend :kunsk., modersm., tyska o. hist. m. samh:lära v. Ronneby isam-realsk. fr. 27 o. rektor där 28-45. Led. av stadsfullm. 14-34, folksk :s’tyr. sed. 12, v. ordf. 16-18 o. ordf. sed. 19, ordf. i o. förest, f. Ronneby föreläsn :fören. iSed. 16, tryckfrih :omb. i Ronneby sed. 16. RVO.
translated: Hallberg, Klas Wilhelm, former principal, from Ronneby, born on June 15, 1880 in Ryssby, Kalmar County. Married in 1908 to Ossie Aström, and they had one son named Olof, born in 1917. Klas was an ex-Mog, graduated in Kalmar in 1903, fil. candidate in Uppsala in 1907, studied at Marburg University in 1905, at Jena University in 1909, and in language and pedagogy in Germany in 1911 and 1928. He was an appointed teacher at Uppsala Pedagogical Practice School from 1905 to 1906, substitute teacher in Köping from 1906, in Kalmar from 1907 to 1908, and in Kalmar Public School from 1907. He was also the director of Lindesberg Technical Evening School from 1908 to 1910, principal of Lindesberg State-funded Joint School at the same time, director of Ronneby Technical Evening School from 1910 to 1912, principal at the same time, and director of the Ronneby Municipal Middle School from 1912 to 1928. He was an adjunct in Christian knowledge, Swedish, German, history with social studies at Ronneby Upper Secondary School from 1927, and principal there from 1928 to 1945. Klas was a member of the City Council from 1914 to 1934, a member of the Primary School Committee since 1912, vice-chairman from 1916 to 1918, and chairman since 1919. He was also the chairman and director of the Ronneby Lecture and Educational Association from 1916 and the Press Freedom Commissioner in Ronneby since 1916. He was awarded the RVO.

structured.name: Klas Wilhelm Hallberg
structured.description: Former principal of Ronneby schools and member of the City Council
